Header.Name: ngamsErrDef.xml
Header.Description: This XML document contains the definition of the error logs used within the NG/AMS project.

LogDefEl.LogText: No Storage Set matching the Slot ID: %s. Check NG/AMS Configuration: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: NG/AMS could not find a Storage Set which matches the given Slot ID. There seems to be a problem in the NG/AMS Configuration.

LogDefEl.LogText: No mime-type/extension mappings defined in configuration file: %s (Element: MimeTypes)!
LogDefEl.Description: There are no mime-types/Data Handling Plug-In mappings defined in the NG/AMS Configuration. These are necessary in order to have each type of data file properly handled by NG/AMS.

LogDefEl.LogText: Could not find element: %s in NG/AMS Configuration: %s. Must be specified!
LogDefEl.Description: The element referred to in the log text, was not found in the configuration file as expected. Must be specified in order to run the NG/AMS Server.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem creating Global Bad Files Directory: %s specified in configuration file: %s. Parameter: FileHandling.GlobalBadDirLoc.
LogDefEl.Description: The Global Bad Files Directory could not be created. Make the parent directory writable for the NG/AMS Server host account and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The value defined for the property referred is not properly defined. Must define a proper value. Check configuration file and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s
LogDefEl.Description: An error occurred while parsing the configuration file at the position in the document as indicated by the error message. Check/correct configuration file and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal path specified for Root Directory in configuration file: %s (Parameter: Server.RootDirectory). Path given: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The directory specified as Root Directory is not writable or not existing. Create this and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem encountered attempting to load the NG/AMS Configuration: %s. Error message: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The specified configuration file could not be loaded. This could e.g. be due to that the file is not readable (has not read permissions) for the user running NG/AMS, or that the file is not available.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal path specified for Processing Directory in configuration file: %s (Parameter: FileHandling.ProcessingDirectory). Path given: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The directory specified as Processing Directory is not writable or not existing. Create this and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Plug-In Parameters are improperly formatted: %s. Correct format is: (par)=(value),(par)=(value)...
LogDefEl.Description: The Plug-IN Parameters defined in connection with a plug-in are not formatted as expected.

LogDefEl.LogText: Error - Disk ID: %s, not found in DB!
LogDefEl.Description: Could not find the Disk ID referred, in the DB.

LogDefEl.LogText: DB Connection not open - trying to reconnect ...
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred interacting with the DB. It will be attempted to connect again, to see if problem may be rectified.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problems communicating with the DB: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred interacting with the DB. It may be temporarily impossible to communicate with the DB server. When this situation occurs, the system can buffer frames (if configured to do this). It will be attempted to archive these buffered frames at a later stage.

LogDefEl.LogText: Table ngas_hosts in the NGAS DB could not be accessed.
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while trying to access the ngas_hosts table in the NGAS DB. This in some cases is accepted as it is possible to operate NG/AMS without the availability of ngas_hosts.

LogDefEl.LogText: Did not find entry for NGAS Host: %s in DB table ngas_hosts.
LogDefEl.Description: An entry is missing in the ngas_hosts table for an NGAS Host referred to e.g. in a request. This information is needed for instance in connection with the CLONE or RETRIEVE command to be able to locate files in an NGAS System.

LogDefEl.LogText: Unique constraint violated in DB.
LogDefEl.Description: An SQL statement violated an unique constraint in the DB.

LogDefEl.LogText: Disk in slot: %s, with Logical Name: %s, is previously registered as a Main Disk but is now installed in a Replication Disk slot.
LogDefEl.Description: When a disk has been registered by the system as being a Main Disk, it should not be attempted to use it later as a Replication Disk. The way to recover from this problem is to install the disk in a Main Disk Slot, together with the Replication Disk with which it was originally registered.

LogDefEl.LogText: Disk in slot: %s, with Logical Name: %s, has previously been registered as a Replication Disk but is now installed in a Main Disk slot.
LogDefEl.Description: When a disk has been registered by the system as being a Replication Disk, it should not be attempted to use it later as a Main Disk. The way to recover from this problem is to install the disk in a Replication Disk Slot, together with the Main Disk with which it was originally registered.

LogDefEl.LogText: Disk with ID: %s is not accessible (writable).
LogDefEl.Description: NG/AMS probes for each disk installed and configured for an archiving system if it is possible to write on the disk. If not an error is returned.

LogDefEl.LogText: No target disks found for the Stream(s) with mime-type(s): %s.
LogDefEl.Description: For each Data Stream Defined in the configuration file, a target disk must be available in order for the system to be able to handle Archive Requests.

LogDefEl.LogText: Error querying information for disk with ID: %s - cannot generate disk status on disk!
LogDefEl.Description:
An error occurred while trying to query information about a disk from the NGAS DB. This means that it is not possible to generate the NGAS Disk Info Status File on the disk. This file is normally generated when the system goes Online/Offline. The status file for the disk in question, may not be up to date.
Note, maybe the problem is caused by incorrect information in connection with the disk. Could also be caused by a general problem with the communication with the DB server.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while executing the Offline Plug-In. The system could not be brought properly to Offline State, or some actions may have been skipped.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while executing the Online Plug-In. The system could not be brought properly to Offline State, or some actions may have been skipped.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problems occurred initializing NG/AMS Server. Error message: %s
LogDefEl.Description: An error occurred while initializing the NG/AMS Server. The server could not be prepared for execution, and was terminated. Consult the NG/AMS Logs for further information.

LogDefEl.LogText: Apparently an instance of the NG/AMS Server is running or the server was not shut down properly previously! If it is desirable to force the server to start, use the -force command line parameter.
LogDefEl.Description:
Another instance of the NG/AMS Server may be running already as it was intended to start a session. Having several NG/AMS Servers running in parallel, may cause conflicts. If it is the intention to star a new session the previous server should be terminated. Otherwise, if it is the intention to run two servers, another communication port number could be specified.
A new session can be forced started using the -force command line option.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem setting up logging properties! Check if log file: %s can be created! Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred setting up the properties for the logging. Check the configuration file and/or the command line input parameters and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problems operating NG/AMS Server: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The NG/AMS Server could not be started. This could because by conflicting port numbers, or other problems in connection with the network set-up.

LogDefEl.LogText: Warning -- No Disks available in this NGAS System. NGAS ID: %s. Host ID: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: No disks are available in this NGAS System. This may be OK if the server is only acting as a proxy for other NGAS Nodes.

LogDefEl.LogText: No Storage Sets found for mime-type: %s
LogDefEl.Description: No available Storage Set (disk set) was found for storing the data with the Mime-type as referred above in the error message. Check the disk configuration and the NG/AMS Configuration.

LogDefEl.LogText: NO SUITABLE TARGET DISK FOUND FOR DATA WITH MIME-TYPE: %s. - PROBABLY NEED TO CHANGE DISKS!
LogDefEl.Description: No suitable Storage Set (disks) was found for storing the data with the Mime-type as referred above in the error message. Check the disk configuration and the NG/AMS Configuration.

LogDefEl.LogText: Starting/initializing NG/AMS Server - Version: %s - Host: %s - Port %d
LogDefEl.Description: The NG/AMS Server is initializing and preparing for execution.

LogDefEl.LogText: NG/AMS Server terminating - Version: %s - Host: %s - Port %d
LogDefEl.Description: The NG/AMS Server is cleaning and preparing to terminate execution.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem sending email notification message to: %s sender: %s, using SMTP host: %s. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The system could not send an Email Notification Message to the destination specified using the SMTP host specified. Check if the parameters are correct, in particular if the SMTP host is correctly specified and accessible.

LogDefEl.LogText: Number of files checked: %d. Number of unregistered files found: %d. Number of bad files found: %d. Amount of data checked: %.3f MB. Checking rate: %.5f MB/s. Total time for checking: %.3fs.
LogDefEl.Description: After one Data Checking cycle has been executed, it is possible to configure NG/AMS to generate a log entry in the log outputs (CFG: NgamsCfg.FileHandling:DataCheckLogSummary).

LogDefEl.LogText: An error occurred while archiving data found in NG/AMS Back-Log Buffer. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: An error was encountered when the NG/AMS Janitor Thread tried to archive a file found in the NG/AMS Back-Log Buffer. The symptom/type of the error is indicated in the error message.

LogDefEl.LogText: Not enough disk space for creating file: %s, of size: %d bytes.
LogDefEl.Description: NG/AMS could not create a file with the given name of the given size.

LogDefEl.LogText: Could not move file from location: %s to new location: %s. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: Problems occurred while trying to move/rename a file. If this happens while handling an Archive Request, the file cannot be archived and will be buffered in the Back-Log Buffer and handled at a later point in time.

LogDefEl.LogText: The minimum amount of free system disk space (%d MB) is exceeded. Directories/parameters concerned: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The system monitors the minimum free amount of disk space that should be available for the the directories used by NG/AMS for the operation. If the amount of free disk space for one of these directories (defined in the configuration file), goes below a certain limit, the system will go automatically in Offline State and will not perform any further requests or operations.

LogDefEl.LogText: Could not copy file from location: %s to new location: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: Problems occurred while trying to copying a file.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem occurred retrieving key(s): %s, from data file: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The keyword cards listed above, could not be found in the file referred. This means that the handling of the file could not be carried out as expected.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s
LogDefEl.Description:
An error occurred in the Data Handling Plug-In - the file has not been handled successfully, and has not been archived.
The data in the file will be back-log buffered and attempted handled at a later stage.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s
LogDefEl.Description:
An error occurred in the Data Handling Plug-In - the file has not been handled successfully, and has not been archived.
The data in the file will be discarded by NG/AMS.

LogDefEl.LogText: Error occurred handling file: %s in DAPI: %s, Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description:
A DAPI detected a problem/inconsistency in the file being handled. The file is considered as bad and cannot be archived properly.
The file will be discarded.

LogDefEl.LogText: Error occurred handling request! Error/exception: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while handling a request issued to NG/AMS. The request could not be carried out successfully.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem occurred handling Archive Push Request! URI: %s. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while handling an Archive Push Request. The archive request has not been carried out successfully. It should be investigated what caused the problem, and the file should possibly be archived again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problems occurred handling Archive Pull Request! URI: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while handling an Archive Pull Request. The archive request has not been carried out successfully. It should be investigated what caused the problem, and the file should possibly be archived again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Must specify a URI for the data file to archive!
LogDefEl.Description: When issuing an archive request, a URI must always be specified. This is used as reference to the file, and in the case of an Archive Pull Request, the URI is used to actually pick up the file.

LogDefEl.LogText: Could not determine mime-type for data file with URI: %s. Check NG/AMS Configuration.
LogDefEl.Description: From the extension of the file URI given, the mime-type could not be determined, i.e., is not among the mime-types defined in the configuration file. Check the configuration file to see if support for this type of data file should be added.

LogDefEl.LogText: %s not allowed when in State/Sub-State: %s/%s. Allowed State(s)/Sub-State(s) are: %s/%s.
LogDefEl.Description: The request issued cannot be handled by NG/AMS when in the State/Sub-State as indicated in the error message. Bring the system to one of the allowed States/Sub-States listed in the error message and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal command: %s received. Rejecting request!
LogDefEl.Description: The command issued is not known/accepted by the NG/AMS Server. Check context and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: This NG/AMS is not configured for accepting %s Requests. Rejecting request!
LogDefEl.Description: This installation of NG/AMS, is not configured for accepting the request type as specified in the error message. Re-consider the request issued, or to configure the server to handle the given type of request.

LogDefEl.LogText: Incorrect parameter given for RETRIEVE command.
LogDefEl.Description: The syntax specified for the RETRIEVE command is illegal.

LogDefEl.LogText: File with ID: %s appears not to be available.
LogDefEl.Description: It was requested by a client to retrieve information about a certain file, or to return the file. This file however, appears not to be available. Check the File ID and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Could not retrieve information about disk with Disk ID: %s. Disk is probably unknown to this NG/AMS! Rejecting request!
LogDefEl.Description: NG/AMS was requested by a client to return information about a specific disk. This disk however, is not known to NG/AMS. Check the Disk ID (or other information given with the query) and try again.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal retrieve request. Reason: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The Retrieve Request could not be carried out due to the reason/problem described in the error message.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problems occurred while handling file with URI: %s. Data will be Back-Log Buffered, and attempted archived at a later stage. Previous error message: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while handling an Archive Request. The kind of error that occurred, may be recovered later. The data has therefore been buffered by NG/AMS, and will be attempted archived (by an internal procedure) at a later stage.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem encountered, while storing data in Staging Area File: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while storing the data on the HTTP connection into the Staging Area on the target disk. This might be caused by that the Staging Area directory is inaccessible, or the target disk as such, or that that there is no more space in the Staging Area.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem encountered, while storing data of file with URI: %s, in Back-Log Buffer: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem occurred while storing data in the Back-Log Buffer Area. This might be caused by that the Back-Log Buffer directory is inaccessible, or the target disk as such, or that that there is no more space in the Staging Area.

LogDefEl.LogText: Note: File issued with URI: %s was already archived and has been re-ingested!
LogDefEl.Description: The file issued was already archived and has been re-ingested into NGAS. This means in practice that an additional copy of the file is available in the NGAS data repository.

LogDefEl.LogText: Archiving file with URI: %s
LogDefEl.Description: NG/AMS is about to handle/archive the file referenced in the log message. An additional message (additional messages) will follow this one indicating if the archiving was successful or not.

LogDefEl.LogText: Successfully archived file with URI: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The file referenced by its URI in the log message was successfully handled/archived by NG/AMS

LogDefEl.LogText: Missing parameter: %s in connection with command: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: Together with the command issued, the parameter listed above should have been issued. Since this is not the case, the request cannot be handled.

LogDefEl.LogText: File with File ID: %s, is available on NGAS Host with Host ID: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The file with the given File ID, is available and accessible on the NGAS system contacted.

LogDefEl.LogText: File with File ID: %s, is not available on NGAS Host with Host ID: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The file with the given File ID, is not available/accessible on the NGAS Node contacted.

LogDefEl.LogText: Redirection URL: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The resource requested is not available on the NGAS Node contacted, and the NG/AMS Server on this system cannot act as proxy to handle the request. The request should be re-send by the client, using the re-direction URL given.

LogDefEl.LogText: The service: %s is not available on this system.
LogDefEl.Description: The service needed for fulfilling the request is not available on this NG/AMS System. Could e.g. be File Retrieval.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal DPPI: %s specified in connection with Retrieve Request. Given DPPI is not defined in the NG/AMS Configuration.
LogDefEl.Description: An NG/AMS installation only accepts to execute DPPIs, which are explicitly defined in the NG/AMS Configuration. If a DPPI is specified, which is not defined in the configuration this will be rejected even if this DPPI might be available as such on the NGAS host handling the request. The problem can be solved by adding the name of the DPPI in the configuration file provided that this DPPI in fact is available on the system and that it is desirable to make this DPPI available for external users.

LogDefEl.LogText: The combination of parameters given together with the command: %s is illegal. Parameter(s): %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The combinations of parameters given together with the command referred to in the error message is illegal (syntactic or semantically) wrong. Check the NG/AMS User's Manual or the online NG/AMS help for further information about the command.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem(s) encountered executing command: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem or problems was/were encountered while executing the command indicated in the error message. This may be due to an illegal combination of parameters, or due to that prerequisites for executing the command are not fulfilled.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem(s) encountered deleting file from disk. Disk ID: %s, File ID: %s, File Version: %d. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A problem or problems was/were encountered while trying to delete the referenced file from an NGAS disk. Could be due to e.g. that the disk is read-only mounted or that the file itself is read-only.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem(s) encountered deleting file info from DB. Disk ID: %s, File ID: %s, File Version: %d. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A problem or problems was/were encountered while trying to delete the information for the referenced file from an NGAS DB. Could be due to that the DB user has not permission to carry out DELETE SQL statements.

LogDefEl.LogText: Successfully deleted info for file. Disk ID: %s, File ID: %s, File Version: %d.
LogDefEl.Description: The information for a file was successfully removed from the NGAS DB and from the NGAS disk hosting the file.

LogDefEl.LogText: File deletion status. Files Selected: %d, Files Deleted: %d, Failed File Deletions: %d.
LogDefEl.Description: Status over a REMFILE command indicating 1) How many files were selected for deletion, 2) How many files were deleted, 3) How many attempts to delete file that failed.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem encountered deleting files on disk. Disk ID: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem was encountered while trying to delete files on the disk with the Disk ID given in the error message. Maybe the disk is mounted read-only.

LogDefEl.LogText: Problem encountered deleting disk info from DB. Disk ID: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A problem was encountered while trying to delete the information for a disk from the NGAS DB. Maybe the DB user used, does not have permission to execute DELETE SQL statements.

LogDefEl.LogText: Successfully deleted info for disk. Disk ID: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The information for a disk was successfully removed from the NGAS DB and the files on the disk successfully deleted.

LogDefEl.LogText: Info for disk selected for deletion. Disk ID: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: The REMDISK command given, would delete the disk referenced to in the log message if execute=1 would be specified.

LogDefEl.LogText: No disk found on NGAS Host: %s with Disk ID: %s. No disk selected.
LogDefEl.Description: The REMDISK command given, did not match any disk installed in the contacted NGAS Host.

LogDefEl.LogText: One or more files requested to be deleted are not available in at least 3 independent copies within this NGAS system.
LogDefEl.Description:
For security reasons it is enforced by NG/AMS to have at least two independent copies of each file (defined by a File ID + File Version).
In case of a REMDISK or REMFILE command, it will be checked for each file that would be deleted by the request, if it is available within the NGAS system in at least 3 independent copies.
Independent copies is defined as instances of one file stored on different storage media.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal mime-type: %s issued in Archive Request for file with URI: %s. Rejecting request.
LogDefEl.Description: The mime-type specified in the Archive Request for the file with the given URI is unknown to this NG/AMS installation. Check the configuration.

LogDefEl.LogText: The target disk specified with Disk ID: %s cannot store more files (is completed). Remarks: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A disk specified as Target Disk for storing files, is marked as completed and cannot store more files. This error can occurr for instance during an CLONE command when a Target Disk is explicitly specified, which cannot be used as storage disk.

LogDefEl.LogText: Illegal path or filename specified: %s. Context: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A filename or path specified, does not exists or is not readable/accessible.

LogDefEl.LogText: One or more files stored on a disk, which contents is about to be deleted are not registered in the NGAS DB.
LogDefEl.Description:
For security reasons NG/AMS do not allow to remove files not registered in the NGAS DB, as these could be valuable files, which should not be deleted.
It is necessary to remove these files (manually) or to archive them onto another media, before the disk can be removed.

LogDefEl.LogText: Cloned file - File ID: %s, File Version: %s, located on disk with ID: %s and host with ID %s
LogDefEl.Description: The file with the given ID and version, which is located on the host referenced, was successfully cloned.

LogDefEl.LogText: Failed in cloning file - File ID: %s, File Version: %s, located on disk with ID: %s and host with ID %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The file with the given ID and version, which is located on the host referenced, could not be cloned.

LogDefEl.LogText: The clone command was rejected. Reason: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The CLONE command could not be exeucted due to the reason given in the error message.

LogDefEl.LogText: Registered file: %s - File ID: %s, File Version: %s, Format: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The file with the path specified, was registered successfully in the NGAS DB.

LogDefEl.LogText: Failed in registering file: %s. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: The file with the path specified, could not be registered in the NGAS DB.

LogDefEl.LogText: Checked file with File ID: %s/File Version: %d/Disk ID: %s/Slot ID: %s/ Host ID: %s - file found to be consistent.
LogDefEl.Description: A consistency check was carried out on the referenced file. The file was found to be OK.

LogDefEl.LogText: Checked file with File ID: %s/File Version: %d/Disk ID: %s/Slot ID: %s/ Host ID: %s - file found to be inconsistent%s
LogDefEl.Description: A consistency check was carried out on the referenced file, one or more discrepancies were detected.

LogDefEl.LogText: An error occurred while trying to communicate with NG/AMS Server on host/port: %s/%d. Error: %s
LogDefEl.Description: An error was encountered while trying to communicate the the NG/AMS Server referenced. The type of problem is indicated if possible.

LogDefEl.LogText: The specified Request ID: %s is not (or no-longer) registered.
LogDefEl.Description: The specified Request ID is not registered in the list of Request IDs. It may also be that the request was finished, and the entry removed from the internal list.

LogDefEl.LogText: The URI specified: %s is illegal. Context: %s
LogDefEl.Description: A URI given e.g. with an Archive Command is illegal and the resource referred to cannot be accessed.

LogDefEl.LogText: File requested to be deleted cannot be removed. The file(s) might be read-only or be marked to be ignored or as bad in the DB.
LogDefEl.Description: A REMFILE or REMDISK command could not be execute because one or more files scheduled for deletion could not be removed.

LogDefEl.LogText: The maximum number of simultaneous requests (%d) has been exceeded. The request cannot be handled now. Rejecting request.
LogDefEl.Description: The Maximum Number of Simultaneous Requests (defined by the configuration parameter Ngams:MaxSimReqs) has been exhausted. The request cannot be handled. It should be retried later to issue the reuqest.

LogDefEl.LogText: File scheduled to be discarded not found: %s. NGAS Node: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A file referenced with by its Disk ID, File ID and File Version, or by its path, could not be located on the contacted system.

LogDefEl.LogText: File scheduled to be discarded not removable: %s. NGAS Node: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A file referenced with by its Disk ID, File ID and File Version, or by its path, cannot be removed.

LogDefEl.LogText: File discard request granted. File: %s. NGAS Node %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A file referenced with by its Disk ID, File ID and File Version, or its path can be discarded.

LogDefEl.LogText: File discarded: %s. NGAS Node: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A file referenced with by its Disk ID, File ID and File Version, or its path was successfully discarded.

LogDefEl.LogText: File discard request failed: %s. NGAS Node: %s. Error: %s.
LogDefEl.Description: A file referenced with by its Disk ID, File ID and File Version, or its path could not be discarded.

LogDefEl.LogText: Handling of Archive Request for mime-type: %s is possible on node: %s
LogDefEl.Description: Data files with the given mime-type can be handled on the referenced node at this point in time.

LogDefEl.LogText: Handling of Archive Request for mime-type: %s is not possible on node: %s
LogDefEl.Description: Data files with the given mime-type cannot be handled on the referenced node at this point in time or in general.

LogDefEl.LogText: Error occurred while receiving data for file with URI: %s. Expected size: %d bytes. Actual size: %d bytes.
LogDefEl.Description: An error ocurred while receiving the data in connection with an Archive Request. Less bytes were received than expected. This could be caused by a communication issue on the network connection between the client and the server.

LogDefEl.LogText: Unauthorized request received.
LogDefEl.Description: A request was issued to a server, which has HTTP Authentication enabled. The client did not provide a valid authentication code.
